level.heading: Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services behavioral health and compliance report.
level.text: The Mayor shall submit a report to the Council by March 30 of each year, which shall include:
Who were committed to the Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services ("DYRS") during the previous calendar year;
Who received the required behavioral health screening;
Whose behavioral health screening identified a need for further behavioral health assessment;
Who received a behavioral health assessment; and
Who were referred to appropriate services;
The reasons why a committed youth in DYRS did not receive the required behavioral health screening or behavioral health assessment, if any; and

If necessary, recommendations on how DYRS can ensure that all of its committed youth are receiving the required behavioral health screenings and behavioral health assessments along with an estimate of the time it will take to meet that requirement.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Section 601 of D.C. Law 19-141, as amended by D.C. Law 19-168, § 7004, provided that §§ 302(b)(1), 304, and 502(a) of the act shall apply upon the inclusion of their fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan.

Section 601 of D.C. Law 19-141, as amended by D.C. Law 20-61, § 4112, provided that §§ 302(b)(1)(A) and (C) and 304(b)(1)(D) of D.C. Law 19-141 shall apply to public charter schools upon the inclusion of their fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan, as certified by the Chief Financial Officer to the Budget Director of the Council in a certification published by the Council in the District of Columbia Register. Section 302(b)(1)(A) of D.C. Law 19-141 added § 38-203(i)(A-i); Section 302(b)(1)(C) of D.C. Law 19-141 added § 38-203(i)(B-i); and Section 304(b)(1)(D) of D.C. Law 19-141 added 5 DCMR § A2103(c)(6).
